properties.areaDesc: Harper, KS; Sumner, KS; Sedgwick, KS
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:31PM CST until January 10 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Wichita KS
properties.description:
At 1224 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated flooding across the warned
area. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen. Flooding is
occurring in parts of downtown Wichita.

The rains have lessened in Eastern Harper and Western Sumner
counties but further flooding remains likely.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Wichita, Haysville, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Goddard,
Maize, Clearwater, Anthony, Sedgwick, Colwich, Conway Springs, Garden
Plain, Downtown Wichita, Kechi, Eastborough, Bentley, Argonia, Viola
and West Wichita.

An additional one inch of rain is possible in the warned area,
especially across eastern Sedgwick County.
properties.instruction:
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will continue to cause flooding
of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and
underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas.

There were reports of a few stranded vehicles in Wichita. Avoid
driving into flooded areas!

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.

NWSheadline: A FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR SEDGWICK... EASTERN HARPER AND WESTERN SUMNER COUNTIES
